DOC.brief_summary: To notify the effect of aspiration of excessive endometrial fluid in addition to Diosmin in cases undergoing intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) cycles.
DOC.brief_title: Aspiration of Excessive Endometrial Fluid at the Day of Ovum Retrieval Plus Diosmin in (ICSI) Cycles
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives: To notify the effect of aspiration of excessive endometrial fluid in addition to Diosmin in cases undergoing intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) cycles. Study design: Prospective randomized controlled clinical trial. Patients and Methods: 200 women with excessive endometrial fluid by transvaginal ultrasound during ICSI cycles are randomly scheduled into two equal groups. In group A, one tab every 8 hs Diosmin ( 500mg) beginning from the day of ovum retrieval in addition to aspiration of the fluid by an IUI catheter ; while in group B (control group), no thing is given or done. The main outcome measures are presence of the fluid on the day of embryo transfer and the pregnancy rate on those patients.
DOC.criteria: women with excessive endometrial fluid by transvaginal ultrasound during ICSI cycles
